comments:
When Code Assist is activated in a Java file, just after the list box appears, an SWT error is thrown, wanting to close Eclipse. I've pasted the session header and the specific error below.

Windows XP SP2 Tablet PC Edition (Pro with some add-ons)
Eclipse SDK 3.1.2

This error appeared in Eclipse 3.1.0 as well. I can not reproduce it on a different system, but it consistantly appears on my tablet.

I should note that none of the other systems I tested on were WinXP Tablet. (One was WinXP Pro SP2, other was WinXP Pro SP1.5)

Windows can't create a shell.  The only thing I can think of is that the shell that is being created is a hover help shell and that is failing somehow.  Since Eclipse came up, then top level shells can be created.  The code assist shell is a dialog shell and that seems to work.

Could you try running the ControlExample and playing with the 'Shell' tab to determine which decoration styles etc. work or fail?
